description: The Master of Science in Agricultural Education is designed for agricultural specialists in schools, community colleges, university extension, and industry who wish to continue their professional development. The program is specifically designed to provide graduate-level education for individuals who are preparing for or who are currently employed in positions in agricultural education. This degree provides students with the flexibility to design a program to meet their individual career goals in formal and non-formal agricultural education. Students can pursue a thesis or a professional paper as a culminating activity for the program.
Program name: Master of Science in Agricultural Education

description:
The Master of Arts program in anthropology provides students with a broad-based background in the discipline of anthropology that combines a holistic four-field approach with a specific focus on the practice of anthropology. Students receive training in archaeological and cultural resource management, forensics, and museum studies, and graduate with the ability to both practice anthropology and to teach. We also provide a sound basis for students planning to continue to a PhD program.

The program is designed to provide a graduate-level curriculum within a four-field approach for a limited number of students in a small university environment. It will serve those students who are going on to PhD programs as well as those who are pursuing careers where a master's degree is the terminal degree. Emphasis is placed on one-on-one student/faculty interaction.
Program name: Master of Arts in Anthropology

description: The Master of Arts in Art History is a two-year course of study designed to provide a broad historical and theoretical understanding of the visual arts. The curriculum includes an introduction to research methods and historiography, as well as seminars on a variety of topics. Students work closely with art history faculty in their areas of specialization. The degree culminates in a major research paper that constitutes the master’s thesis. The MA program in Art History prepares students for a variety of art-related jobs as well as for admission to PhD programs in Art History.
Program name: Master of Arts in Art and Art History

description: The master of science degree in biological sciences is designed to provide advanced study in biology for students who plan to pursue a career in biological research, teaching, or related applied fields. The program prepares students for continued study at the doctoral level. The degree program is tailored to the individual student’s interest. Students work closely with a faculty advisory committee of their choice to develop an individualized course of study. Students select one of two plans for the MS degree. Plan A (thesis) students conduct original biological research, and Plan B (professional paper) students conduct a comprehensive literature review on a biological topic. Close association with the faculty is a major strength of the program. Students may conduct research in faculty labs or in the field at the Big Chico Creek Ecological Reserve or other university facilities. Opportunities for research are available in areas of ecology, evolution, cellular, molecular, and organismal biology.
Program name: Master of Science in Biological Sciences

Concentration name: ['General MBA Option', 'MBA Option in Enterprise Information Systems', 'MBA Option in Project Management']
description: The Chico State MBA program is designed for students with any undergraduate background. We provide a high-quality MBA education that is accessible and affordable. Our program is perfect for both working professionals and recent graduates. Students can take classes at their own pace, either part time or full time. The on-campus program can be completed in as little as 16 months, while the online program can be completed in as little as 24 months. We offer three MBA program options: a general MBA, an option in enterprise information systems, and an option in project management. The MBA program is taught by our dedicated faculty who are renowned teachers, researchers, and community partners. Students enjoy small class sizes and numerous opportunities to work on hands-on consulting projects.
Accreditation status: The College of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB). This is the highest standard of achievement for business schools, and it is a distinction earned by only five percent of the business schools worldwide.
Program name: Master of Business Administration
Master of Business Administration—Online

description: The Master of Science in Business Analytics (MS-BANA) is a STEM-designated degree program that prepares students with the essential skills to become successful business analysts in the new data-driven economy. Graduates will gain expertise in data management, statistical analysis, data mining, and machine learning, and they will be able to apply these skills to solve real-world business problems. Our program provides a solid foundation for careers in a variety of industries, including marketing, finance, accounting, supply chain management, and healthcare. This is a 30-unit program delivered in a cohort model consisting of ten 3-unit courses. It is designed to be completed in one year and classes are scheduled to accommodate working professionals. The MS in Business Analytics program is offered fully in-person. The GMAT/GRE is not required for admission.
Accreditation status: The College of Business is proud to be accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB International) for both its business and accounting programs.
Program name: Master of Science in Business Analytics

description: The graduate program in Communication Sciences and Disorders at California State University, Chico provides students with a rich academic and clinical experience in preparation for a career as a speech-language pathologist. The graduate curriculum is designed to be rigorous and comprehensive, challenging students to achieve their highest potential. Students who complete the master's degree meet the academic and clinical requirements for the Certificate of Clinical Competence in Speech-Language Pathology from the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association, the California state license in speech-language pathology, and the Speech-Language Pathology Services Credential from the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing.
Accreditation status: The Master of Science program in speech-language pathology at California State University, Chico is accredited by the Council on Academic Accreditation in Audiology and Speech-Language Pathology (CAA) of the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association, 2200 Research Boulevard #310, Rockville, Maryland 20850, 800-498-2071 or 301-296-5700.
Program name: Master of Science in Communication Sciences and Disorders

description: The Master of Science in computer science offers a high-quality, broad-based education in computer science. It provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary for employment in the computing industry and for further study in a doctoral program. The core of the program focuses on fundamental concepts in computer science, and students can pursue specialized topics by selecting electives and a culminating activity. The MS in computer science program is open to students who have a bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline.
Program name: Master of Science in Computer Science

description: The Master of Science in Computer Science online degree completion program provides a comprehensive professional education in computer science to prepare students for a career in the dynamic field of computing or for advanced study. The program blends theoretical foundations of computer science with the state-of-the-art in software development. Students will gain experience with current technologies and tools and learn how to apply them to solve real-world problems. They will also learn how to communicate their solutions and ideas effectively to their peers, customers, and supervisors. The program is specifically designed to accommodate students with diverse academic backgrounds. A set of preparatory courses is offered to provide students with the prerequisite knowledge needed for the master’s-level coursework.
Program name: Master of Science in Computer Science—Online

description: The Master of Science in Data Science and Analytics is a fully online program that provides students with the advanced knowledge and skills necessary to be leaders in data science and analytics. The curriculum consists of advanced coursework in data science and analytics, and an applied culminating experience through which students will demonstrate mastery of the program learning outcomes. Students completing the program will be well prepared to enter into or advance in a diverse range of professions that use data to drive decisions.
Program name: Master of Science in Data Science and Analytics

description: The Master of Science in Earth and Environmental Science provides students with advanced training in earth and environmental sciences to prepare them for careers with government agencies and private consulting, or for continued academic work toward a PhD. Students focus on one of three concentrations: Environmental Science, Hydrology, or Physical and Environmental Geology. Students in the program work closely with faculty mentors on a variety of field- and laboratory-based research projects related to their interests. The program is committed to a field-based curriculum and a hands-on learning environment. Students gain a wide range of analytical experience in our laboratory facilities. Many graduate students receive support through teaching assistantships or grants.
Program name: Master of Science in Earth and Environmental Science

description: The Master of Arts in Education program at Chico State is designed to deepen your understanding of contemporary educational issues. The curriculum centers on developing skills in educational research, curriculum theory and development, and the application of learning theory. Courses examine education through a variety of perspectives—historical, political, philosophical, social, and cultural. This program is ideal for educators who want to enhance their practice, advance on the salary schedule, pursue leadership opportunities, and prepare for doctoral studies. Students complete 30 units of study, concluding with an oral defense of a thesis, project, or comprehensive exam.
Accreditation status: The School of Education at Chico State is accredited by the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing (CTC). All programs in the College of Communication and Education are accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC).
Program name: Master of Arts in Education

description: The Certificate in Educational Technology and Distance Learning is a fully online certificate program designed for K-12 educators, educational leaders, corporate trainers, and those who seek to improve their online design and technology skills in P-20, public, or private settings. Courses examine the most current and emerging technologies to engage learners of all ages. Participants have opportunities to experiment with a variety of technology tools and resources. Each course provides hands-on opportunities to design and create a range of multimedia materials and projects for teaching and learning. Courses completed for the certificate may be applied to the MA in Education option in curriculum and instruction with the approval of the graduate coordinator.
Program name: Certificate in Educational Technology and Distance Learning

description: The Master of Science in Electrical and Computer Engineering provides advanced knowledge and skills in specialized areas for students who desire a career in research, development, and design in industrial, governmental, and academic settings. The goal of the MS ECE program is to produce high-quality masters-level engineers who are able to apply modern theory, tools, and techniques to solve real-world problems. The program is specifically designed to provide a balance between theory and practice and prepare the students for the challenges of the 21st century. The MS ECE students have two options for completing their degree: thesis option or project option.
Program name: Master of Science in Electrical and Computer Engineering

Concentration name: Literary Studies Option, Creative Writing Option, Special-Major Option
description: The Master of Arts in English at Chico State provides students with a rich and varied engagement with literary study. The graduate curriculum combines broad training in literary history, literary theory, and pedagogy with specialized seminars in a wide range of topics, periods, and theoretical approaches. Students in our program benefit from small classes and close working relationships with our dedicated graduate faculty. In addition to a rigorous course of study, MA students have many opportunities to develop as professionals. Most of our graduate students gain valuable teaching experience in our first-year composition program, and many others work as tutors in the Student Learning Center. Our graduate students present their work at conferences, publish their essays in journals, and are regularly accepted into prestigious PhD programs.
Program name: Master of Arts in English

description: The Master of Arts in History is a 30-unit program that provides advanced study in selected fields of history, offers training in historical research and writing, and culminates in a thesis or a comprehensive exam. We have both a general program and an option in public history. Students work closely with faculty members in small seminars and on individual research projects. This close interaction is one of the chief attractions of our department. Graduate seminars are devoted to intensive reading, discussion, and writing on selected topics. We work with students in the credential program. Please speak to the graduate coordinator for more information on our integrated credential program. The MA in history at Chico State helps prepare students for a variety of careers. Our graduates have gone on to doctoral programs, teaching careers at the secondary and community college levels, and positions in archives, museums, and other government agencies. We also welcome students who wish to pursue a master's degree for personal enrichment.
Program name: Master of Arts in History

description: The Interdisciplinary Studies MA/MS is for students who want to create their own graduate degree from two or more academic departments. Students design a curriculum to address a specific academic interest or professional objective that cannot be met by an existing graduate program. Recent graduates have used their degree for career advancement in social work, business, environmental agencies, community organizations, and the arts.
Program name: Master of Arts/Master of Science in Interdisciplinary Studies

description: The graduate program in kinesiology provides an intensive course of study based on scientific principles of physical activity and their application in the sub-disciplines of biomechanics, exercise physiology, motor control/learning, sport and exercise psychology, and sport sociology. The program prepares students for advanced doctoral studies and for careers in fields related to health, wellness, physical activity, and sport.
Program name: Master of Science in Kinesiology

description: The MA in Language Teaching is an interdisciplinary program that prepares students to teach languages in a wide variety of contexts in the U.S. and abroad. The program offers two tracks: Second Language Teaching and Spanish. Students in both tracks have the opportunity to take courses from both the Department of English and the Department of International Languages, Literatures, and Cultures. The MA in Language Teaching is a two-year program for full-time students. Part-time students may take up to seven years to complete the degree. In their final semester, all students are required to write a master’s project or thesis. Graduates of the program are well-prepared to work as language teachers at any level, from elementary school to university. Many also find work in curriculum development and design, language program administration, and language testing and assessment. Others choose to continue their studies in a PhD program.
Program name: Master of Arts in Language Teaching

description: The graduate program in mathematics is a vibrant community of faculty and students. We are committed to excellence in teaching and research in mathematics and mathematics education. Our graduate program provides a supportive environment for students to learn advanced mathematics and develop as mathematicians and educators. The Master of Science in Mathematics has two options: Mathematics Education and Pure Mathematics. Our program prepares students with the skills needed to succeed in industry, education, and in doctoral programs.
Program name: Master of Science in Mathematics

description: The Master of Science in Nutritional Science provides an opportunity for advanced study in nutritional science, preparing students for careers in nutrition and dietetics. The program enhances skills and competencies of students for positions in administration, advocacy, counseling, education, and research in government, health care, industry, private practice, and the community. The program provides current, in-depth knowledge of nutritional science, including macronutrient and micronutrient metabolism, as well as an emphasis on research methods. The graduate curriculum provides students with the academic proficiency needed to pursue doctoral studies.
Program name: Master of Science in Nutritional Science

description: The Master of Arts in Political Science program provides students with comprehensive and specialized knowledge in the field of political science. It is designed to prepare students for teaching at the community college level, for a variety of careers in government and the private sector, and for doctoral programs in political science and related fields. The department's graduate seminars are small, providing for a close working relationship between students and faculty. Students work with a graduate advisor in their primary field to develop a specific program of study.
Program name: Master of Arts in Political Science

description: The Master of Arts Program in Psychological Science at California State University, Chico is a two-year graduate program designed for students who plan to go on to a doctoral program in psychology and/or who are interested in a master's level career in research. In our program, students receive mentoring and hands-on research experience with our faculty. They also take graduate-level coursework in a variety of content areas of psychology. All of our students complete a master's thesis, which they defend in an oral examination. Through this experience, students receive intensive training in the research process from the design of a study to the dissemination of findings.
Program name: Master of Arts in Psychology

description: The Master of Science in Psychology with the Marriage and Family Therapy (MFT) option is a 60-unit program designed to prepare students for licensure as a Marriage and Family Therapist in the state of California. Students who graduate from the MFT program at Chico State are eligible to sit for the MFT licensure exams as regulated by the California Board of Behavioral Sciences (BBS). Our program is designed to train ethical, multiculturally-aware, and competent psychotherapists who can serve the diverse needs of the North State and beyond. We prepare students through a combination of coursework, clinical practicum, research, and professional development.
Accreditation status: The Master of Science in Psychology degree at CSU, Chico is accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC). The MFT program is NOT accredited by the Commission on Accreditation for Marriage and Family Therapy Education (COAMFTE). COAMFTE accreditation is not required for licensure as an MFT in California. Our MFT program is designed to meet the requirements of the California Board of Behavioral Sciences (BBS) to enable our graduates to pursue licensure.
Program name: Master of Science in Psychology

Concentration name: General MPA Option, Health Administration Option
description: The Master of Public Administration (MPA) at California State University, Chico is a nationally accredited, 39-unit professional degree for those who wish to enter or advance in a career in public or nonprofit service. The program is designed to develop the knowledge and skills necessary for the effective and ethical management and leadership of public and nonprofit organizations in an increasingly diverse and dynamic society. Graduates of the Master of Public Administration program will be able to: 1. Lead and manage in public governance; 2. Participate in and contribute to the policy process; 3. Analyze, synthesize, think critically, solve problems, and make decisions; 4. Articulate and apply a public service perspective; 5. Communicate and interact productively with a diverse and changing workforce and citizenry.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Network of Schools of Public Policy, Affairs, and Administration (NASPAA) Commission on Peer Review & Accreditation.
Program name: Master of Public Administration

description: The Master of Science in Regenerative Agriculture is an interdisciplinary degree program housed within the College of Agriculture. The program is designed for students with a passion for agriculture and a commitment to build a more sustainable and equitable food system. The program's core philosophy is that agriculture must be regenerative of natural resources and socially just to be truly sustainable. The MS in Regenerative Agriculture is a research-focused degree where students work closely with a faculty advisor to conduct an original research project that culminates in a master's thesis. Throughout their program, students take a range of coursework across campus to build a solid foundation in the principles and practices of regenerative agriculture. Students also receive specialized training in research design, grant writing, and science communication.
Program name: Master of Science in Regenerative Agriculture Interdisciplinary Studies

Concentration name: ['Special Case Pattern', 'Teaching College Social Science Pattern']
description: The Master of Arts in Social Science is an interdisciplinary program designed for students with diverse backgrounds and career goals. Students customize their programs of study in consultation with the graduate coordinator. The special case pattern allows students to design their own MA in consultation with the graduate coordinator. Special case students select courses from at least three different disciplines with no more than 12 units coming from any one discipline. The teaching college social science pattern is a more structured program focusing on sociology, political science, and United States history to prepare students who plan to teach in the California Community College system. Both patterns require the completion of a master's thesis or project.
Program name: Master of Arts in Social Science

description: The mission of the Master of Social Work (MSW) Program is to provide graduate students with a quality educational experience that prepares them for advanced generalist practice in a rural context. The program is specifically committed to educating students who will work with and on behalf of oppressed, impoverished and otherwise disenfranchised individuals, families, groups, and communities. The curriculum is delivered to facilitate the integration of foundation and advanced-level competencies for ethical and effective social work practice.
Accreditation status: The Master of Social Work program at California State University, Chico is fully accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).
Program name: Master of Social Work

description: The Master of Science in Wildland Management is an interdisciplinary program including course work in agriculture, biological sciences, geosciences, and social science. The program addresses the science and management of wildlands including the physical, biological, and social factors that influence them. The program is designed for students with undergraduate degrees in a range of fields, including biology, agriculture, geography, environmental science, recreation, and related resource management disciplines. The program provides the knowledge and skills for a variety of careers managing wildlands in public agencies and the private sector. It can also be a preparatory degree for a PhD program.
Program name: Master of Science in Wildland Management Interdisciplinary Studies

description: The Certificate in Land Use and Environmental Planning is an 18-unit program for classified graduate students and for post-baccalaureate students not seeking a master's degree. It is designed to prepare students for professional practice as land use and environmental planners with city, county, and state agencies, and with private consulting firms. It is also designed to serve those already in planning or related fields (e.g., city managers, civil engineers, architects) who wish to acquire specialized professional training.
Program name: Certificate in Land Use and Environmental Planning

description: The Certificate in Data Science is a multi-disciplinary certificate program offered by the Department of Mathematics and Statistics, the Department of Computer Science, and the Department of Business Information Systems that prepares students to use modern computational and statistical techniques to analyze, interpret, and visualize data from a wide variety of sources. This certificate helps students find employment in the rapidly growing field of data science, as well as prepare for graduate studies in data science, analytics, or a related field.
Program name: Certificate in Data Science
